geosiris.proposal2_2.BoundaryFeatureInte:
Element that lets you index and order feature interpretations which must be boundaries (horizon, faults and frontiers) or boundary sets (fault network). For possible ordering criteria, see OrderingCriteria.

BUSINESS RULE: Only BoundaryFeatureInterpretation and FeatureInterpretationSet having faults as homogeneous type must be used to build a StructuralOrganizationInterpretation.

Classe Java pour BoundaryFeatureInterpretationPlusItsRank complex type.

Le fragment de schéma suivant indique le contenu attendu figurant dans cette classe.


 <complexType name="BoundaryFeatureInterpretationPlusItsRank">
   <complexContent>
     <restriction base="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}anyType">
       <sequence>
         <element name="StratigraphicRank" type="{common_dev5x_2_3.energyml}NonNegativeLong" minOccurs="0"/>
         <element name="BoundaryFeatureInterpretation" type="{common_dev5x_2_3.energyml}DataObjectReference" minOccurs="0"/>
         <element name="FaultCollection" type="{common_dev5x_2_3.energyml}DataObjectReference" minOccurs="0"/>
       </sequence>
     </restriction>
   </complexContent>
 </complexType>
geosiris.proposal2_2.CollectionsToDataob:
A representation based on set of triangulated mesh patches, which gets its geometry from a 1D array of points.

BUSINESS RULE: The orientation of all the triangles of this representation must be consistent.

geosiris.proposal2_2.StructuralOrganizat:
One of the main types of RESQML organizations, this class gathers boundary interpretations (e.g., horizons, faults and fault networks) plus frontier features and their relationships (contacts interpretations), which when taken together define the structure of a part of the earth.
IMPLEMENTATION RULE: Two use cases are presented:
1. If the relative age or apparent depth between faults and horizons is unknown, the writer must provide all individual faults within the UnorderedFaultCollection FeatureInterpretationSet.
2. Else, the writer must provide individual faults and fault collections within the OrderedBoundaryFeatureInterpretation list.
BUSINESS RULE: Two use cases are processed:
1 - If relative age or apparent depth between faults and horizons is unknown, writer must provides all individual faults within the UnorderedFaultCollection FeatureInterpretationSet.
2 - Else, individual faults and fault collections are provided within the OrderedBoundaryFeatureInterpretation list.

Classe Java pour StructuralOrganizationInterpretation complex type.

Le fragment de schéma suivant indique le contenu attendu figurant dans cette classe.


 <complexType name="StructuralOrganizationInterpretation">
   <complexContent>
     <extension base="{resqml_dev5x_2_2.energyml}AbstractOrganizationInterpretation">
       <sequence>
         <element name="OrderingCriteria" type="{resqml_dev5x_2_2.energyml}OrderingCriteria"/>
         <element name="OrderedBoundaryFeatureInterpretation" type="{resqml_dev5x_2_2.energyml}BoundaryFeatureInterpretationPlusItsRank" maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0"/>
         <element name="UnorderedFaultCollection" type="{resqml_dev5x_2_2.energyml}FeatureInterpretationSet" minOccurs="0"/>
         <element name="Sides" type="{common_dev5x_2_3.energyml}DataObjectReference" maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0"/>
         <element name="BottomFrontier" type="{common_dev5x_2_3.energyml}DataObjectReference" maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0"/>
         <element name="TopFrontier" type="{common_dev5x_2_3.energyml}DataObjectReference" maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0"/>
       </sequence>
     </extension>
   </complexContent>
 </complexType>
